citation.article-title: Nesterenkonia lacusekhoensis sp. nov., isolated from hypersaline Ekho Lake, East Antarctica, and emended description of the genus Nesterenkonia.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Nesterenkonia

The description of the genus Nesterenkonia is as given by Stackebrandt et al. (1995) but with the following amendments: cells may consist of short rods sometimes showing branching, or of cocci. The peptidoglycan type is A4Î±, L-Lys-Gly-L-Glu or L-Lys-L-Glu. Menaquinones are present, MK-7, MK-8 and MK-9 predominating. The G+C content of the DNA is 66-72 mol%.
